page.title: 08THE ORPEN PLAYERS,W.BERGHOLT
page.content: DURING THE SUMMER OF 1969 A FEW WEST BERGHOLT RESIDENTS CALLED A PUBLIC MEETING WITH THE OBJECT OF ORGANISING VARIOUS SOCIAL ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE VILLAGE.IT WAS FROM THIS GATHERING THAT THE{'ORPEN PLAYERS' } WAS BORN,SO NAMED BECAUSE THE VENUE FOR THE PERFORMANCES WOULD BE THE ORPEN MEMORIAL HALL. IN NOVEMBER THE FIRST PRODUCTION WAS STAGED.THE SUCCESS OF THIS VENTURE SPURRED THEM ON AND NOW SOME SIXTEEN YEARS LATER THEY CAN LOOK BACK WITH JUSTIFIABLE PRIDE ON THEIR ACHIEVMENTS.THE YEARS HAVE BEEN BUSY ONES WITH THIRTY TWO PLAYS PERFORMED,EIGHT 'OLD TYME MUSIC HALLS' AND TEN PANTOMIMES.THEY HAVE GAINED AN ASSORTMENT OF ACCOLADES ALONG THE WAY AND ACLAIM FROM VARIOUS 'CRITICS'.SOME MEMBERS PARTICIPATE AT THE COLCHESTER TATTOO AND CARNIVAL.
